page.title: 12WOODLAND
page.content: Tintern Forest runs above and behind Tintern,facing the Forest of Dean,the south-western fringe of which stretches along the east bank of the River Wye. All the woodland is under the auspices of the Forestry Commission with planting and felling being strictly controlled.Once wholly broad leaved,there are now stretches of evergreens. The steepness of the valley sides necessitates the maintenance of tree coverage to reduce soil erosion. Visitors increase fire risk in these vulnerable areas so waymarked paths and nature trails cover the area to enable the public to take full advantage of the flora and fauna.
